question: فرض کنید $A=\left[ \begin{matrix} 1 & -1 & c \\ 0 & 7 & 2 \\ \end{matrix} \right]$ و $B=\left[ \begin{matrix} a & 1 \\ b & -1 \\ 1 & 3 \\ \end{matrix} \right]$. اگر $|AB|\,=1$ و ${{(AB)}^{-1}}=AB$ ، مقدار $a$ کدام است؟
explanation: $AB=\left[ \begin{matrix} 1 & -1 & c \\ 0 & 7 & 2 \\ \end{matrix} \right]\,\left[ \begin{matrix} a & 1 \\ b & -1 \\ 1 & 3 \\ \end{matrix} \right]=\left[ \begin{matrix} a-b+c & 2+3c \\ 7b+2 & -1 \\ \end{matrix} \right]$ ${{(AB)}^{-1}}=AB\Rightarrow \dfrac{1}{|AB|}\left[ \begin{matrix} -1 & -2-3c \\ -7b-2 & a-b+c \\ \end{matrix} \right]=\left[ \begin{matrix} a-b+c & 2+3c \\ 7b+2 & -1 \\ \end{matrix} \right]$ $\xrightarrow{|AB|\,=1}\,\left[ \begin{matrix} -1 & -2-3c \\ -7b-2 & a-b+c \\ \end{matrix} \right]=\left[ \begin{matrix} a-b+c & 2+3c \\ 7b+2 & -1 \\ \end{matrix} \right]$ $\Rightarrow \left\{ \begin{aligned} & a-b+c=-1 \\ & -2-3c=2+3c \\ & -7b-2=7b+2 \\ \end{aligned} \right.\Rightarrow \left\{ \begin{aligned} & b=-\dfrac{2}{7} \\ & c=-\dfrac{2}{3} \\ \end{aligned} \right.\Rightarrow a+\dfrac{2}{7}-\dfrac{2}{3}=-1\,$ $\xrightarrow{\times 21}21a+6-14=-21\Rightarrow 21a=-13\Rightarrow a=-\dfrac{13}{21}$
